column4: i understand that this resizes all images in a folder(convert -resize 750Ã—500 *.jpg)....... another website says to use (find . -iname "*.jpg" | xargs -l -i convert -resize 800x600 {} ../small/{} ) which is obviously a lot longer.. whats the difference?

the first command uses shell expansion, so the "*.jpg" gets replaced in place by the list of files before convert is invoked. The second gets the list of all files first and invokes convert one time for each file.
in this case, no; in other cases, yes. It depends on the arguments accepted by the program.
The second variant is definitely safer.
